bestBHT.bht: On that day, Jesus went out of the house and sat by the seaside, seeking relief from the stress and strain. Whether he left to converse with his mother and brethren or simply to withdraw, he found solace along the shore. This picturesque scene on the shore of the Sea of Galilee, also known as the Sea of Tiberias, provided a refreshing change for Jesus on that particular day.

Henry Alford: The words certainly do bear that meaning in Mark iv. 35, and important consequences follow."
But in Acts viii. 1 they are as evidently indefinite."
The instances of their occurrence in John (xiv. 20; xvi. 23, 26) are not to the point, their use there being prophetical.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: 1. The same day went Jesus out of
the house, and sat by the seaside.
Philip Schaff: On that day. Probably, but not certainly, the same day."
Out of the house. If a particular house is meant, that in which 'his mother and brethren' sought Him."
The sea-side, the shore of the Lake of Galilee.
Archibald T. Robertson: On that day...it serves as a specimen of many others filled to the full with stress and strain.
Jesus came out of the stuffy house and took his seat along the shore with the crowds stretched up and down, a picturesque scene.
John Gill: The reason of his going out of the house was, either to converse with his mother and brethren, as they desired; or to withdraw himself from company, and take some refreshment by the sea side; or because it would not hold the people, and therefore he quitted it for a more convenient place.
And sat by the sea side; either as weary, and for his refreshment, or in order to preach to the people.
This was the sea of Galilee, sometimes called the sea of Tiberias.

bhtAttempts.bht: On that day, Jesus, feeling the stress and strain of the packed house, decided to step out and find solace along the picturesque shore of the sea. It's unclear whether he left the house to converse with his mother and brethren or simply to withdraw from the crowd. Nevertheless, he found himself sitting by the sea, either seeking refreshment or preparing to preach to the people gathered there. This sea, known as the Sea of Galilee or the Sea of Tiberias, provided a much-needed change of scenery for Jesus on that day.

This sea, known as the Sea of Galilee or the Sea of Tiberias, provided a much-needed change of scenery for Jesus on that day.

This sea, known as the Sea of Galilee or the Sea of Tiberias, provided a much-needed change of scenery for Jesus on that particular day.
